result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Serenna R. Lingis not in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Serenna R. Lingis.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. Working on discovery, just provided an offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Serenna R. Lingis not in court.  Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski in court for Serenna R. Lingis. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Waiting for offer. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Serenna R Lingis in court. Vivien TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. State has not yet made charging decision. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): J.I. OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-3047 thru 3052
